definition: interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
interjection of surprise/Oh my!
interjection of surprise or pain/Oh/Ow/My goodness!

sentences.english: J: You have a very busy life. Lots of a week activies.
sentences.chinese: 你生活很充實啊，有很多的活動。

sentences.english: He told me that I should have sold tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我，我必須賣票啊。

sentences.english: Oh dear, I'd been looking forward to warmer weather here.
sentences.chinese: 噢天啊，我原期望這兒會有較暖和的天氣。

sentences.english: You want to know more about Ili?
sentences.chinese: 你想更多地瞭解伊犁啊？

sentences.english: 'I am, ' replied the Doger. 'I'd scorn to be anything else.
sentences.chinese: “是啊，”機靈鬼答道，“別的行當我還瞧不上呢。”

sentences.english: What, there is also a Suti Causeway here?
What, there is also a Suti Causeway here?
Lord, we are responsible for much of the suffering in this world.
sentences.chinese: 主啊，我們對世界上的苦難要付上大部分的責任。

sentences.english: But that's what Microsoft said about Windows and IE.
sentences.chinese: 但微軟也正是這樣說視窗和IE的啊。

sentences.english: Doudou has been home half a month, how I miss him.
sentences.chinese: 豆豆回家已經半個月了，我好想他啊。

sentences.english: Where have I read something about dungeons?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪讀過過關於地牢的東西啊？

sentences.english: You have the nerve to call that fine?
sentences.chinese: 你爲這個叫好，你神經錯亂啊？

sentences.english: O, boy! Is Last night's wine of Loess Plateau sweet?
sentences.chinese: 男孩啊，黃土高坡昨夜的酒，可好。

sentences.english: How beautiful maleness is, if it finds its right expression.
sentences.chinese: 雄性是多美啊，假如它發現它正確的表達方式。

definition: (particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
battle cry
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
but/however/(used for emphasis) indeed
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
(onom.) laughing out loud
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
(onom.) smack!
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
hey (to call sb)
hey (to express agreement)
hey (to express disagreement)
hey (to express surprise)
sigh (to express regret)

particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")/particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")/particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")/(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action/particle indicating strong affirmation
woolen material
(question particle for "yes-no" questions)
see 嗎啡|吗啡, morphine
so much/this much/how much?/this way/like this
alas/oh dear
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
(a groaning sound)
(nonverbal grunt as interjection)/OK, yeah/what?
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
